abstract: Intel will announce a deal to become the sole supplier of flash memory for a coming Hitachi line of computer drives.
snippet: Intel will announce a deal to become the sole supplier of flash memory for a coming Hitachi line of computer drives.
lead_paragraph: Intel, the world’s largest chip maker, records most of its profit from its core business, the microprocessors that serve as the brains of most computers. But the company’s side venture in flash memory  which is used to store songs on digital music players and photos on digital cameras  has been another story.

headline.main: In Deal With Hitachi, Intel Will Expand Its Flash Memory Business
headline.print_headline: In Deal With Hitachi, Intel Will Expand Its Flash Memory Business
